label: neutral
message: If you take seizures don't drive, very easy to understand.
author: Patricia Pollard

label: negative
message: I didn't know that and was told I needed a letter of clearance from the onset of my 1st Gran Mal that they would never return and we know that can't be guaranteed...so this is very helpful...Dayum! And Shit!
author: Tracie Rodriguez

label: neutral
message: Can we share our Epilepsy tattoos that are conversation starters?
author: Tracy Howell Copella Hanson

label: negative
message: I feel like getting a second one. I want the sign of epilepsy. The purple symbol. Because in May I'll be seizure free for 3 years. That can be my success on what kept my seizures undercotrol. Blessed with my family and friends who's been on my side for 17 years.
author: Erin Berger

label: negative
message: I have epilepsy.  No I hate telling anyone they look at me like im a freak..
author: Melinda J. Lombard

label: negative
message: My son gave me a stuffed frog when he was 4, "to help me feel better". This frog went everywhere through this journey, even into the operating room when I had brain surgery. When I was in the hospital having more testing, I gave Froggy to a poor little girl having the wires put on her head for an EEG, hoping it would "help her feel better". So my first awareness tattoo is so that "Froggy" is still with me. He is on my forearm peeking over the purple Epilepsy ribbon, above my medic-alert bracelet. My second is on my calf, and the Epilpsey "E" always is questioned.  It is a cross with Serenity in the " ---- " and the points have accept, courage, wisdom. In the bottom of the cross is the epilepsy E in red. I wish I could get my computer to post these!
author: Tracy Howell Copella Hanson

label: neutral
message: I am so proud to know the people that I've met who have epilepsy. I'll always remember the person holding the sign during the Epilepsy Walk in Washington D,C. that read, "Epilepsy Doesn't Have Me". It's true in Justin's case.
author: Mark Allison

label: negative
message: I am 14 and was diagnosed at the age of 7. I had my first grand mall when I was 8 on Feb 3 2008. Afterwards they grew more constantly and I would have them more. I now have light aura's aka ocular epileptic migraines. But I have had this stuffed bear that was given to me by one of the nicest nurses at CHOP in 08. I will never forget that day and I still have the bear. I also hate when people make fun of epilepsy. How would you like it if you were mentally ill or autistic? Huh? People need to think before doing and saying. We all look normal outside but on the inside we are all different.
author: Nicolas Herbetko

label: negative
message: I tell people often that I have epilepsy, and share it on Facebook.  I like being able to help with some people's misconceptions.  I do NOT share it when applying for a job.
author: Sally Willis-Watkins

label: negative
message: I too have epilepsy! Started having seizures when I was 71years old.Am 73 now. Have had them under control for almost a year now. Dr's have not been able to determine what caused them!
author: Judith Palmore

label: positive
message: I've never been shy about not telling people about my epilepsy....though the places I've had seizures are anything but personal.  I know all of you share the same sentiments as me in that we want everyone to know it's not this weird, fatal, strange disease.  It's actually controlled by drugs and we lead normal lives.
author: Patti Collette

label: negative
message: My first seizure I was in a head on collusion. Fun way to find out. Had 2 following that and happy to say mine are under control and haven't had one since October 2006! My friend from work has a soon to be 1yr old who started having frequent, not yet controllable seizures only a month ago. Breaks my heart for her!!
author: Lisa Hayes

label: neutral
message: I have seizures but they r some what controlled with medicine, but if im VERY stressed out or having a serious asthma attack i will have a seizure. It sucks cause i will never b able 2 drive. Roads r stressful (according 2 my parents and doctors) so i have 2 rely on other ppl 2 drive me where i need 2 go.

label: neutral
message: Yes.  They are under control and one Grand Mal 30 plus years ago.  I'm good

label: negative

label: neutral
message: The school and little league are scared to have her.  I have wondered about getting an epilepsy dog to have with her at all times but they are really expensive.  Any thoughts or ideas?

label: negative
message: My daughter was diagnosed at 2 yrs old.  We have been struggling with control since then.  She hates going to the doctor.  She goes this Friday for another test.

Ha! Pick  which time period? As a kid, adults connected it with retardation,  that slowness was the med side effect. Teased going through school, especially since I was a woman by 4th grade. My e is near this area of my brain.
Job wise nobody wanted an epileptic yet 20 years of daycare and parents knowing I had it and the kids taught much. Many are teaching or in the health field. I am proud of accomplishments.  O yea I have a Above ave iq and BSA degree

label: negative

I got married,gave birth twice,raised my kids alone,did groceries carried them home and thanked GID for the helping hands and love of my family!!

label: positive
message:
I have the same type seizures.I don't drive either I have Lupus which led to the seizures which started 3years ago.
My family take me where I need to go,I hate that I can't drive but as you say it indangers others

label: negative
message: I stopped driving. My hubby takes me everywhere I need to go, and doesn't mind. He'd rather do it then have me dead. The seizures scare him enough. Me too.

label: negative
message: I have never been able to drive & would never take the risk of endangering others. I just really hate having to rely on others all the time, being an afterthought, only doing what I want if it's a convenience for someone else. Id really like to have my own life
author: Trisha Ramsey

label: negative
message: I have epilepsy and I live in the Dallas area. I use the train and bus system to get around.  If they won't get close enough then I can take my bike on the train like others do. There are ways to get around thats safer than driving when you have epilepsy. Asking a friend is even safer than riding a bike.
author: Mark Allison

label: negative
message: I do all of this and still have seizures.  Had one the other day 10 minutes after working out!
author: Erica Acord Griffin

label: negative
message: I am just now finding out that I am not alone.  Except for my neurologist, even my family doctor when I was diagnosed in 2008 thought epilepsy was a mental disorder and required a shrink - that's it.   When I had my first seizure, I was in the middle of breast cancer surgery/treatment complications (double masect, failed reconstructions, septic infections- - which is probably what caused the epilepsy), but all of that pales in comparison to the experience of the epilepsy diagnosis.  I could not remember where I lived, where I worked, thought my daughter was 9 when she was 11, didn't remember that our dog had passed away (2 years prior), etc. Could only remember a select few people.   What has happened since then, and my evolvement and enlightenment is still unfolding.
author: Gina Goodman

label: negative
message: Those of us with eilepsy understand what she said. I gave up driving, and became a "Stay At Home Dad", and my wife worked.. Giving up a carreer is not the same as giving up just a drivers license. Memory is another issue that we deal with regarding our epilespy.
author: Mark Allison

label: negative
message: I agree with Terressa as far as the quiz games. It gets frustrating at times but has helped me alot. Luckily I have family and friends that will try to fill in the blank spots. One thing I've learned is noone needs to let me pick the movie lol last time I rented from redbox every movie I brought home we had already watched ;)

label: negative

label: negative
message: Epileptics understand this issue, this is the same for me, my only difference was that most people I have heard of got a career, relationship, house, all those kind of things in life before they started having issues.  My situation started while I was still in school, early college really, so I didn't have any of those things, and because I didn't have anything that is why my relationship left me.  I am still lucky enough to have a loving mother who cares and knows at least partially what I am going through, and allows me to live with her.

label: positive

label: negative

label: negative

label: neutral
message: Remain very insistent with your doctor if you believe you are having seizures. If he or she does not help/listen/etc then seek help from another doctor. Personal experience: the final straw was a neurologist telling me I was mentally unstable (these are my words, as his were not as nice) & I checked myself into a psych center. 3 weeks later I was diagnosed with Temporal Lobe Epilepsy. TRUST YOUR GUT!!!

Prayed and was able to get myself to a safe spot, feeling I was going to have another granmal seizure, but I was fully awake. I'm still trying to understand what partial-onset seizures are. Is that what I experienced? In the past, I didn't get warnings. I would just blackout and go into a seizure.

label: negative
message: This is the kind i have...I am fully aware what is going on, function as normal, but have a hard time even saying words, or explaining to others what is going on. As long as I'm not involved in a conversation, no one is aware! To me it feels as all the sudden, people are talking a different language! I can't understand anything they say....i am aware though why i do not understand them.
author: Joanna Hartley

label: negative
message: Any one who has seizures my bf has them would love to have a seizure buddy to talk to when he has them I am really down right now so if you need me as much as I need you befriend me and tell me your story I am really alone might be nice to talk to someone
author: Racheal Jean E-Zahn

label: negative
message: I have more than one type of seizure.  I have simple partial seizures, complex partial seizures, petite mal seizures, and grand mal seizure.  They did not start until I was 18 yrs old.  I had been having déjà vu for as long as I can remember, but thought everyone had that.  One night I woke up in a complex type seizure.  My parents took me to the hospital where I had a grand mal seizure.  It took a month or more to mentally get back to normal.  No doctor has ever been successful at controlling mine.  Most months if I am going to have one, it will happen two weeks prior to my menstrual cycle begins.  I had a simple partial seizure two days ago right after exercising.  My memory is effected by my seizure.  Sometimes it takes days to be back to normal and sometimes it only hours.  I am a teacher with a Masters Degree in School Counseling.  It is by God's grace that I have mentally been able to accomplish what I have.  The seizures are very frustrating for me.  I do not like not being able to remember things.  No one seems to understand.  I have to work EXTRA hard to compensate for it.  I just take it a day at a time.  That is all I can do.
author: Erica Acord Griffin

label: negative
message: Simple partials would just be an aura. For me it was a rising epigastric sensation--kind of like going down hill on a roller coaster-- and a sudden feeling of doom. I would also instantly become hyper - aware of my surroundings. All of this in just a few seconds. During a complex partial, I would have the aura and I would sense a need to escape. I would then usually try to escape whatever situation I was in. I wouldn't remember anything past the aura. I once tried to get out of a moving car.
author: Tristin Seagraves Johnson

label: negative
message: Sometimes when I walk I just stop walking and want to talk and know what I want to say but can't move or talk, it's very frustrating....our I don't know I have one at all until the very end I feel my sell come out of it like aura people talk about our someone tells me I had one

label: negative

label: negative

At a meeting for work a few weeks ago I went all dizzy and had my right and left mixed up. The girls I work with were acting like school girls going "no I'm saving this seat for someone" there's one to your left, right, left, right...right Til I got to the front where the boss was sitting

label: negative
message: I think people need to be more aware and educated to find out the different seizures that a person with epilepsy may be having. I've been epileptic since my late teens and people are still afraid to come near me when having a seizure.

label: positive
message: Great idea for explaining all different types of seizures! As Evangelina says below, the awareness about seizures/ epilepsy must be spread. I feel invisible a lot of times and these forums are an excellent way to spread the word!
author: Laurie Poeschl

label: negative
message: It took me years to work up the nerve to tell my doctor what was happening with me pretty regularly.  When I was then diagnosed, I realized one of the worst and most embarrassing moments of my career was during an interview (for a job I REALLY wanted) where I was doing a simple Excel kind of "proof of my skills" and couldn't even figure out what I was looking at, let alone put together VLookup functions.  It was humiliating, needless to say they hired someone else.  I still wish I could go back and tell them "I wasn't lying! I am smarter than I seemed that day! I didn't know I have epilepsy and that was a seizure!"   This explains almost exactly how it was.  I have longer seizures than that but it's explained very similarly to what happens with me.
author: Erin Lindsey

label: positive
message: I know how you feel and go through. I had Epilepsy and seizures for many years. I was cured through the power of prayer. God is great.
author: Oscar Villegas

label: negative
message: Chris is a good friend of mine. He is the campus pastor of the college I attended. It wasn't until after I graduated that I found out that he also had epilepsy. I reached out to him when I had my left temporal lobectomy. Chris is a very awesome guy. One I really look up to.
author: Tristin Seagraves Johnson

label: positive
message: It is good to explain/warn people about the risk of yourself having a seizure and what to do when it happens. The downside (in my experience) is some individuals deny seizures exist until they see them for themselves. Better safe than sorry though!
author: Carissa Armstrong

author: Epilepsy Advocate

label: negative
message: I must confess, even after two accidents, it took a threat from a neurologist to turn me in the the Department of Motor Vehicles (DMV) if I didn't surrender my license, in order to get me to stop driving.  Thankfully, my first accident only involved me and my car.  I actually injured - thank the Lord not seriously - a person in the second accident, went for several years without driving, then started back up again.  At a regularly scheduled appointment, the neurologist saw me dig my car keys out of my pocket as I was leaving his office.  He gave me until the end of the next business day, to turn my license in to the DMV, or he would report me - and he made good on that promise.  I was FURIOUS at the time, but have been thankful ever since.  My son is a fire fighter/paramedic, and has told me some real horror stories of accidents he's seen that were caused by people with epilepsy, in which they or someone they hit was seriously injured or killed, because the patient, whose seizures weren't 100% controlled, continued to drive either without a license, or they had never told anyone they had epilepsy, and still had their license.   With help from family, friends, and the local bus, I can get anywhere I need to go.  It's just not worth the risk.  Even as a bus passenger one time, I got off the bus just as one of my complex-partial seizures began.  The next thing I knew - which could have been anywhere from seconds to a couple of minutes - I was standing out in the middle of a six lane major boulevard, horns honking, people yelling, vehicles screeching to a halt, as I stood in the middle of the intersection. I kept my guardian angels busy that day.
author: Tim Tilt

label: negative
message: And people wonder why I never got my license. My seizures aren't always predictable, so for everyone else's safety, I decided to rely on family, friends, public transportation, and my own 2 feet to get where I need to go.
author: Robin Blakeman

label: positive
message: I had a grand mal seizure while driving with my two young daughters in the car. I usually have auras, but not this time. They said I drove through a fence and almost hit a house. While I was still seizing, my foot was still on the gas pedal, causing the engine to rev and smoke everywhere. My girls' apparently were beyond frightened!!  I thank God no one was seriously injured, but I have not driven since that day 4 years ago. It has completely inconvenienced my life...terribly!!! :( But, my girls' beg me to never drive again and the thought is frightening. :( I am still not stable. Why would I put the lives of those I love and others at risk?? :(
author: Melinda Gail Mink

label: neutral
message: I had an accident 8 years ago while I had a complex partial seizure.  Went in between two cars and landed one he roof of my car.  Not hurt.  Would like to, but probably won't drive ever again.
author: Tim Spicer

label: negative
message: I stopped driving several years ago after a man with epilepsy had a seizure and drove through a school and killed a 8 year old girl, I said to myself how would you feel if you did that, you just never know.
author: Dana Marlene

label: neutral
message: I am unable to drive due to Temporal Lobe Epilepsy. I try to walk (very healthy!) every where I can and only use Medical Transportation (bus and cab cost builds quickly) when absolutely needed.Unfortunately (in NYS) epilepsy is seen as a bit of a joke when it comes to these services. This makes no sense as the effort to avoid self-driving is not really for myself but for others :(
author: Carissa Armstrong

label: positive
message: I rolled my car at 120mph in rush hour traffic. I've had 30 operations on my leg and will eventually be an amputee due to my injuries. Don't fool yourself if you think, "I can just pull over." I thought that, too. I had auras. Unfortunately, the last thought in the aura was "get to school safely." To an epileptic- that meant drive fast and a straight line there. I wish I would've never driven with epilepsy.
author: Kathryn Hardaway

label: negative
message: Early in my epilepsy diagnosis I was non-compliant with my meds, and I ran my car under a parked 18-wheel rig. It took the whole roof off my car. If I hadn't fallen sideways I would've been decapitated. I waited the 6 months required by my state, and then with drs permission, began driving. Have been seizure free for 12 years with medication, so now drive regularly. Be compliant. Be wise. Be safe.
author: Darrell Hugueley

label: positive
message: After my 3rd car wreck I said thats it, first one my daughter was with me in the car, 2nd my husband who tried to keep us from going off the road but it didn't work and the 3rd I ran through the light and hit some one head on, thank God she saw me coming at he and was able to move some and no one was hurt just messed up cars, another reason to stop driving.  I decided I would need to be at least a year seizure free before I could drive again..that may never happen but me not driving is safe for others also, as well as myself.
author: Susan Brammer

label: positive
message: i have when a aura comes i keep meds i my gloove chew some wait couple minutes let iy yake effect carry on no accident  ever driving  35 year old  diven back and forth to fl 6 7 time jist lucky and faith in the Jesus <ed><U+00A0><U+00BD><ed><U+00B1><U+008D>
author: Brad Mayo

label: negative
message: Cassidy this is scary but I dont know when mine are coming...
author: Brittany Ingersoll

label: positive
message: It is a must to stop if you feel one coming i all ways did
author: Max Taunton

label: negative
message:
The Epilepsy Advocate Facebook page wants to make sure we direct our community to supportive resources. If you or someone you know is in crisis or emotional distress, please call the Lifeline Network at 1-800-273-TALK (8255). When you dial 1-800-273-TALK, you are calling the crisis center in the Lifeline Network closest to your location. To find out what center is closest to you, search the Crisis Center Locator at www.suicidepreventionlifeline.org/CrisisCenters/Locator.aspx. If you need immediate assistance, please dial 911.
UCB does not endorse and is not responsible for the content on a website not sponsored by UCB.
author: Epilepsy Advocate

label: negative
message:
Just A Dog ?

For all of my animal lover friends....

From time to time, people tell me, "lighten up, it’s just a dog," or, "that’s a lot of money for "just a dog".

They don’t understand all the generous people involved,  the distance traveled, the time spent, the hours of training.  Or the costs involved for "just a dog".

Tim, you are stupid for paying that much money for "just a dog". As Garth saves my life the first week I had "just a dog".

Some of my proudest moments have come about with "just a dog".After all of you made it possible for me to have" just a dog "and all he has done for me I figured it was time to give back, if "just a dog" could bring me so much happiness then why not spread the love! So we visit the Children's hospital and visit with otherwise lonely sienor citizens.  It just makes me happy to see a sick child or lonely sienor get the same joy that I get from "just a dog"! 

Many hours have passed and my only company was "just a dog," because I can now be left alone again so my fiance can work, and have her independence back!  But I did not once feel slighted or afraid being left alone with "just a dog".

Some of my saddest moments have been brought about by "just a dog," and in those days of darkness, the gentle touch of "just a dog" gave me comfort and reason to overcome the day.Or waking up in the ICU units with "just a dog" between my legs quiet and waiting only to check on me! "Just a dog" has never complained, a true loyalty I cannot explain! 

If you, too, think it’s "just a dog," then you will probably understand phrases like "just a friend," "just a sunrise," or "just a promise".

"Just a dog" brings into my life the very essence of friendship, trust, and pure unbridled joy. And now independence and Garth <ed><U+00A0><U+00BD><ed><U+00B0><U+0095> makes it possible to do things that you all take for granted like driving and feeling safe alone, knowing Garth <ed><U+00A0><U+00BD><ed><U+00B0><U+0095> will alert or call help if I seize.

"Just a dog" brings out the compassion and patience that make me a better person.

Because of "just a dog", I will rise early, take long walks and look longingly to the future. Now I can go anywhere with "just a dog" and am comfortable that when the time arises, "just a dog" will do what all those hours of training taught "just a dog" to do!

So for me and folks like me, it’s not "just a dog" but an embodiment of all the hopes and dreams of the future, the fond memories of the past, and the pure joy of the moment.

"Just a dog" brings out what’s good in me and diverts my thoughts away from myself and the worries of the day.

I hope that someday they can understand that it’s not "just a dog", but the thing that gives me humanity, independence and keeps me from being "just a man".

So the next time you hear the phrase "just a dog" just smile... because they "just don’t understand
  Right Garth <ed><U+00A0><U+00BD><ed><U+00B0><U+0095>
author: Tim Mullen

label: positive
message: Question for the advocate..my daughter was discharged from a grooming school(pay by Voc Rehab)the owner let her know that bacause she has seizures she was an issue of laibility. This happed yestarday she has been trying to get her certificate. Voc Reb placed my daughter in that school after evaluated her. I know ADA will procted people w epilepsy and other disabilities in regarding education...can you pls give me advise..

A doctor told me don't expect to have the same life just move forward in your new one. I told him my new one sucks, but I gradually gained courage to keep moving forward into a happy place. I couldn't walk around the block without seizuring but now I go months with no seizures that are major at least. Oh happy day.

She is in her second year of college and stress is part of her seizures. My girl is another women with faith and determination to live a normal life! Keep up the good work! Lets all join hands together and pray!

label: negative
message: Faith and listening to God led me to a great place. I have Epilepsy but the seizures were mostly at night, light ones. The next day I would have terrible Migraine headache and light seizures.  I was given all different medication, nothing worked. Until I was on a plane home, and happen to be seated next to a top Neurologist that had a new medication, that was just right for me? My Neurologist allowed me to take it. It was and has been great. The most important thing I have listened to God's word for me, is to eat well. I ate peanut butter every night. I found foods that I am allergic to THAT being one. It closed my throat,  and caused many of the problems. Another is anti- fungal diet and medication. No white bread, yeast or sugar. This was a cause of low blood sugar. That is a main cause of MY EPILEPSY. I still take medication and always will. Finding a better way to eat, and let God bring you through this,  is the Way. :) I too was in an accident due to not eating. It was the cause of me fainting,  then having a light seizure.I  Never go with my almonds... :) I haven had a seizure in a very very long time.

label: negative
message: I worked for a Community Health Center for 7 years. In those years I have never had a write up or received any disciplinary action. On February 16, 2014 my 13 year old son unexpectedly fell to the ground and proceeded to go into a gran mal seizure. I literally lost my mind! I did not know what happened or what was happening. I called the police, paramedics, and then my former boss. They cared nothing about my son. When I returned to work the next week they fired me and told me to wait after hours to collect my belongings because "they did not want anyone to get upset" about my departure. I called and wrote the EEOC and they did nothing. Maybe contacting the EEOC may work for someone else because they sure don't count epilepsy as a concern.

label: negative
message:
Yes and no. Growing up in the 70's put a huge wedge. My "fits" were an embarrassment in the family, and at that time, I only had petimals. When I started having grandmal seizures in 2002, my married family is very carrying and doing everything they can to help. My friends as well. Great group system. 
Yes, my husband is an over worrier too. It's good and it's bad, but it makes me realize he cares that much about me. He's not doing it because he's embarrassed, but because he's concerned. Been seizure free with medication for 9 years, but we are constantly worried if I will develop a  resistance to my medication,  like I've already had happen. He's someone I can bounce my concerns off of or if I'm feeling something has changed (like memory concerns), I know he's watching out for me.

label: negative
message: Not being able to drive really made me lose a lot of self esteem when i was first diagnosed. I lost all of my independence and began having to rely on others to help me get around. May 2015 will be one year since i have suffered a grand mal seizure. I began seeing a new neurologist a few weeks ago to hopefully be able to start driving again. All i have been dealing with is some sleep issues (sleep walking mainly) since my one yr old son was born. This neurologist ordered an eeg and a sleep study for me. I did my eeg last week and to my surprise, it came back very abnormal. My doctor told me i am suffering from silent seizures and have at least ten or more an hour. This was a huge slap in the face. All this time when i thought i was getting better, i have actually been getting worse. Who knows when i will ever be able to drive or if i will ever be able to drive again. I am just ready to have my life back and be able to take my kids anywhere they need to go without having to make sure it doesnt interfere with anyone elses schedule. It just seems so unfair. Im staying positive as best i can and am searching for an online support group. I refuse to let this illness slip me into a deep depression as it has done in the past. If anyone has any advice for me to point me in the direction of others who also deal with this, it would be greatly appreciated. My doctor increased and added more meds to stabilize the seizures but its up to me of course to not allow this to affect me emotionally. I am just ready to have my life back 100 percent. I want it for my children more than anything.
author: Amy Bronson Martin

label: negative
message: Thank you for sharing this post LaKeisha.  My adult son has not been able to get a driver's license because of partial and complex partial seizures.  We understand what you are feeling. Thanks for the positive approach, it is encouraging to me. He is single and lives at home but I am a senior citizen and could use him taking me places instead of me taking him.  He has never had the independence of getting in car and going where he wants to go, even just for a ride.  We do have door to door transit service available but you have to call 24 hours ahead, so have never used it.  Good to know others understand, God Bless!

Before I was diagnosed with epilepsy I was having episodes of having the chills.

I was diagnosed after having a complex partial seizure where I lose consciousness and had no idea what was happening. It was scary to say the least but especially so for those around me. I have been seizure free for almost 4 years. My heart goes out to anyone who has epilepsy. May the I find a cure soon

message: I have about 4-5 simple partials a day or more depending on the level of stress. I struggle from many other seizures, too. I'm getting a VNS system put in here soon. Prayers for others who feel my pain.

author: Josephine K Miller-Rott

label: negative
message:
A simple partial seizure that only affects your senses is called an aura. 

AURAS

The part of your brain where your seizures originate (your seizure focal point) also may be linked to a specific type of aura because an aura represents the beginning of a seizure. Since different parts of the brain are responsible for different things, the warning signs you experience will be related to the functions of the section of brain where the seizure is about to occur. People whose seizures begin in the temporal lobe tend to have certain types of auras and those whose seizures begin somewhere else often will have different types. 

Here are some types of auras that can happen alone or in combinations…

Visual changes

Kaleidoscope effects, Visual hallucinations, Shimmering sensations, Vibrating visual field, Distortions in size, shape or distance of objects, Bright lights or blobs, Zigzag lines, Tunnel vision, Blind or dark spots in the field of vision, Curtain-like effect over one eye, Blindness in one eye, Motionless stare, Dilated pupils,

Auditory changes

Hallucinations — hearing voices or sounds that don’t exist, Being unable to understand spoken words, Muffled sounds, Buzzing noises, Loud or whispered volume, Temporary deafness

Physical changes

Weakness, unsteadiness, Changes in heart rate, Sweating, Nausea, Vertigo, Saliva collecting in mouth, Lip smacking, Chewing, Swallowing, Strange smells, Problems speaking, Repetitive movements, Limbs jerking involuntarily, Numbness or tingling on one side of face or body, Feeling of being separated from your body, Needing to urinate

Psychological changes

Confusion, Anxiety or fear, Physical detachment, Déjà vu or Jamais vu, a sense of familiarity or unfamiliarity
author: Chris Arceneaux

label: negative
message: Skylar Baxter that's fantastic. Elle Martins I'm so sorry, people can be cruel especially if they don't know anything bout Epilepsy.  My son is epileptic, and he was in a bad accident in 2013 which he had double skull fractures. He got brain damage Doctor said he may never heal and if he goes into a seizure he will die. It scares me so much. He is 22, luckily he hasn't had a seizure since the day of the accident. And he is doing fantastic.
author: Cynthia A. Copeland

label: positive
message: Unfortunately.. I get both of them.. Sometimes I can remember and sometimes  I can't But either way, not fun..
author: Bradley King

label: negative
message: My son is 8, he was just recently diagnosed with complex partial seizers. We did a long term monitoring to find out what part of his brain is causing them and found out it is his whole left side. He is coherent during his seizers and knows everything that is happening. His whole body will stiffen up and shake like with a grand mal but he can speak. He will cry and yell mom over and over until I get by his side. Then he just cries until it is done. Before a seizer happens his right leg will go numb and within 24 hours he will have one. Then immediately after and for about 5-10 minutes his right leg will be numb and he will be unable to move it or stand. When he has a seizer, he will normally have at least two within an hour of each other, but not always. The Dr still doesn't know exactly what is causing them, but now my son has to see a different Dr because his left.
author: Crystal L Hicks

label: neutral
message: I have these and it really afects my short term memory most of all.
author: Amy Bronson Martin

label: negative
message: I have both "Simple and Complex seizures! I have simple partial before I have my Grandmal Seizures. They let me know that I'm going to have a seizure so I can let my family or even coworkers that I'm going to have a seizure and then there's time I don't have a flow blown seizure. The doctors can NOT find any medications to help me! :( :( :( They even look to do surgery but they can't because I have seizure activity coming from both sides of my brain! I just wish there was help for me but I don't think there is! :(
author: Chris Kevin Gresens

label: negative
message: I don't think bartters syndrone with temp. Paralisis can be confused with epilepsy but is similar  because the five senses brings it on.  I strive to stay away from bright flashing lights, loud noises. And crowds for just a few of the things. Avoid extremes but of course children have no control on a lot of these things .  Let me know your thoughts on this.  I have an open mind on this.:)
author: Glenda Wickenhauser

label: negative
message: I was almost home once and had an aura so I knew I was going to have a seizure. I hoped I could get home before the Simple Partial started. My daughter was at my house and told me about the Complex Partial seizure I had at my house. I don't remember walking that last block home or anything she told me. There is a true difference between those types of seizures.
author: Mark Allison

label: negative
message: Our daughter is 28 she has had epilepsy since the age of 13.Last saturday she fell and had to get staples  on her head.I pray someday soon they find a cure.My grandkids worry about mommy,but they understand.
author: Stephany Perry

label: negative
message: My son has two types of seizures, both of which is not good for his brain.

label: neutral
message: I unfortunately suffer from frequent simple partial seizures

label: negative
message: I had complex partial seizures and only when I was sleeping.  So whenever I took a nap or slept at night is when I would have one.  I would wake up with a terrible headache so that's how I knew.

label: negative
message: I wonder if this is what happened to Scott complex partial seizure
author: Toni Mognet

label: negative
message: My daughter was diagnosed with benign rolandic epilepsy this past summer. She has clusters of seizures...all at night while she is falling asleep. Her last cluster was in December right before Christmas...6 in 7 days :( Before, she would go 3 months before the next "cluster" but last night (1-16-15) she had one that lasted about 30 seconds..usually they are only 10 or 15.  She lost ability to speak for about 2-3 minutes and could not sit up in bed...her head hung to one side and her mouth drooped too. :( She says she remembers them, but to see her face (eyes open) she looks like a blank stare. She did remember her older brother trying to help her last night. Would this be a simple partial?
author: Pam Crowson

label: positive
message: Is it only a matter of time before an epileptic is involved in a car accident? I'm getting nervous that there aren't any encouraging stories of folks controlling their condition safely enough to drive...
author: Lane Salmela

label: negative
message: This is what my daughter has...a question to some does it effect your everyday? My daughter will remember one thing but the next day she has forgotten or she may not remember but will the following week or it will depend day to day...I don't see any visible seizures though but she's also recently been dxed on top of her complex partial cscw

label: negative

label: neutral

label: positive

label: negative

label: negative
message: What characteristics are affected by the partial complex seizure , I am aware that intelligence is not effected , but memory and personality changes are as well as emotions , heightened sense of smell and sensations of a certain feeling of being reminded of someone who resembles another person that the person knows ..

label: negative

label: neutral
message: Skylar love ur name!

label: negative
message: My Baby girl 6yrs old ( turning 7 on 2/8) will be doing what ever then extreme panic, scared to death..begging me did i give her her seizure meds, and says she feels like shes ginna have a seizure i ask where she points to the frontof her head, sometimes it ends with a head hurting and vomiting. Or nothing at all. She says she can feel wiggling ...doctor says no way... its always close to her next dose ftom 30 to 10 min .. anyone else??????

label: neutral
message: Not expecting medical advice here necessarily, but is it possible that I can have the tingling sensation in my head occasionally, but not have any other symptoms? I have never been diagnosed with epilepsy.
author: Chesa Harris

label: positive
message: I experience my seizure in 3 of the 4 lobes.  Temporal Lobe symptoms most often.  Parietal Lobe next often and usually mixed with Temporal Lobe symptoms.  Frontal Lobe seizure mixed with the other two lobes happen less frequently.  I can usually breath through the temporal lobe and parietal seizures and keep it from turning into a big seizure.

label: neutral
message: I  agree with that same here I know that I better sit down

label: positive
message: I only have mine when I'm asleep but I wake my self up as it stats to come on as sit up and then it's weard I want to talk but can't I no what's going in but it's mild I no I only can feel my hands clinch.but they have changed a lot since I was 9 that's when they started they were grand mall then I don't no what's going on I think they are changing to another seizure eny one else have this prob ???

label: negative
message: Sleep (lack of) is my only know trigger.  Two days in a week with less than optimal sleep and it can happen.  The stress of needing to sleep or else adds to the problem.  Creates an anxiety that never was there before.  Horrible cycle.

label: negative
message: Wine...but sometimes that does more harm than good. c'est la vie

label: negative
message: I take naps so I don't get over tired. I usually don't have problems, if I do I take medication.

label: neutral
message: No sleep is my biggest trigger. When I do seize (4+ years seizure free knock on wood), it's between 8-10 AM. I'm a total insomniac too.

label: neutral
message: Makes since.....I've had three seizures in Vegas at the casino late at night.   I have since realized how important sleep is while I am there!!

message: Relaxation with deep breathing. The Breath and Relax app is wonderful..

label: negative
message: They say to stay away from caffeine...I found a drink that not only helped with my sleep but my overall health and to be quite honest I think it helped me not have seizures..I drank it every morning faithfully and was always busy and would forget to take my meds (2 times a day) I think I took them 2 times a week and never had a seizure...but I ran out of that drink and as soon as I did I had a seizure...I told my dr what happened he told me to keep drinkin it
author: Melissa Mounce

label: neutral
message: Caffeine? Who would drink caffeine when you have epilepsy? It's a stimulant. Tell people to avoid any type of stimulant when they have epilepsy!

label: negative
message: Catherine did u talk to your doctor about the sleepy time tea??

label: negative
message: Like im goin bye bye

label: negative
message: My son has described it as an electric shock feeling in his brain or that there are paper clips inside of his head and there is a giant magnet on the outside of his head, trying to pull all the paper clips out.
author: Kristin Sullivan

label: positive
message: A blend of vertigo & dejavu.  The  floor is tilted & turning but I'm not dizzy.  I know I've been here & done this before but I'm not sure when.
author: Jessica Smith

label: negative
message: I have a Vagas Nerve Stimulater, VNS, so when I start to have a seizure it turns on and helps control it. Accept when I have them when I am sleeping.  Like the other night.  I bit my lip
author: Lora Carcione

label: negative
message: My neck seems to pull to one side, and I see my image? Or see myself. Then I say I don't feel good and I wake in an ambulance. I don't remember any of the seizure, I had one in August, at Wal-Mart, the one before was 9 yrs before, also at Wal-Mart, this time in the parking lot. Grand mal, bite holes in my tongue, usually have a black eye, or a broken tooth. No answers ever, just" must be stress and exhaustion." I don't even know why they send me to the hospital. Waste of time and money.
author: Suzanne Shelton

label: negative
message: It starts with a numbing sensation around my head and my eyes start to get blurry and I get sometime a queasy feeling in my stomach. Then here comes my seizure my right side of my face droops my speech slurred my head spins and my muscles tighten up and it will go on and off for 15 -20 minutes. Then I am so tired and can't concentrate I need sleep. Sometimes that would be just the first one .
author: Timothy Sprofera

label: negative
message: Similar feelings with aura; nonverbal magnetic feeling pulling in my head weird sensation comes over me. Very aphasic after over sleepy and emotional. Diagnosed at age 9 and never a cause found for them. Last seizure was in 2012. Take your meds, control stress and get plenty of sleep and you can manage epilepsy effectively.
author: Jeri Thomson

label: positive
message: Blink a lot and fireworks. sometimes they are short and can catch them. Other times they catch me and I end up sleeping for a day or two
author: Susan Neblett

label: negative
message: I've been having seizures since the day of my 16 birthday. I'm now 52 years old. I get grandmal seizures, I also get a type of seizure that is a jerking of the right arm and leg as if I were going to fall!! This usually occurs before a grand mal seizure, if I catch it I rub my arm and sit and relax,sometimes it will control the it and I won't get the seizure but sometimes I still do!! It all begins with a headache!! What is it??
author: Maria Rivera

label: negative
message: So many things... when I'm fully aware I feel a dizzy and scared I find a safe place where I won't get hurt in case it gets bigger, a bed or sofa and I grab something soft and bite it until it's over and then I end up really tired with one side of my head hurting and I sleep for hours. Other times I blink alot, lick my lips, my muscles tighten up and sometimes wet myself and become very stubborn not wanting help from whoever is there. I also hear them talk to me and I want to answer but can't, after I need lots of sleep. It's worse when I have a granmal seizure once I nearly bit off half my tongue and I have a few scars. After a granmal seizure I usually need a day or two of sleep....depending on how bad it was.
author: Miriam Franco

label: negative
message: I can hear people when they speak to me but I can no longer process what they are saying. Almost as if they are speaking a foreign language. My brain sometimes inputs its own dialog as well and I know they aren't actually saying what I am hearing. I imagine its what a schizophrenic must feel like. There is also often a dejavu type feeling that feels really wierd and kind of out of bodyish. I am fully aware I am having a seizure as well & am able to kind of communicate that when they happen so I am at least thankful for that.
author: Lizzy Sands

label: positive
message: That's exactly the way mine felt, to the T....
author: Sue Hundley

label: negative
message: I can tell when I'm going to have a seizure I get double vision then my moth goes numb then my hands . Some times I get lucky by walking it off will go have a p - nut butter sandwich and some chorus but once I can't fell  my feet I know I'm done for
author: Joyce Knopps

label: negative
message: I have what you call walking seizures .. Where I can be walking out of a room & if someone is with me & I go into one I might reach over & punch them in the face for no reason !! I feel bad afterwards too for it.. I don't know what you call those types of seizures tho!! I have had seizures since I was 7 & I am 37 & I have had 3 different kinds now that I have been in acoma since 2006.. If you know what they are please tell me..
author: Jennifer Williams

label: positive
message: I feel them coming  rub my fingers together lick my lips stare off for a bit when I come to have no clue what happened for a while n all I want to do is sleep
author: Loren Steinwachs

label: negative
message: I can remember talking with my son on the phone and saying how are you and him saying I don't know. I never thought or even realized maybe this is what what going on. Too much too late. He's gone now from SUDEP. Wish I had known. People please be ware.
author: Kathy Felts

label: neutral
message: What if you dont have partial onset seizures? What if you have full blown Grandmal seizures?
author: Billie Jo Rutherford

label: neutral
message: Waves sounds then a dizzying then num then shaking then lock up passed out I been having them since birth no meds help at all
author: Aaliyah Jones

label: negative
message: I had my first partial seizure yesterday, on my first day back from winter break in my college choir class. Normally I only have absence and a rare grand mal. This one, unlike my others, I could feel myself hitting everything as I went down. Like I was awake, but everything went black and I lost control of my body. I got really dizzy beforehand and then just went down in the middle of warm ups. Pretty embarrassing for me, actually. :(
author: Emily Attebury

label: negative
message:
It's a peculiar feeling, detached and floating but also a tingling. At least that's how it starts. The problem is that they don't stop. One triggers the next in a cascade, which was a nightmare before doctors finally diagnosed me and got me on a drug regimen. 
This year POS became partial complex, which I suppose means the overall situation is getting worse.
author: John VanHez

label: negative
message: I get a very dizzy spinning feeling about 10 sec before I fall. I usually try to sit down during this time but usually wake up on the ground anyways.  I can hear sound before I wake up and I already know ive had one before I open my eyes.  I can never talk or understand much for a few minutes after. I am very weak and my head hurts for up to two days after a episode. Sometimes another seizure follows directly after.  Sometimes I go to the hospital but usually not since in 22 years they have never been able to tell me why.
author: Melissa Smith

label: negative
message: I am 53 right now & have had them since I was 16.I have petit mal seizures that happen once every month or so.Sometimes its a gap of 2 to four months between them.But when they happen,I am asleep somewhere between 8pm 8am & sometimes when I take the medication in the morning,like 7am,I will take my dose,go back to bed & start to feel a lightheaded headache & just sit in bed & do nothing or lay down with my head propped up on a pillow a little,have a few wheat crackers & a little ice-tea & think about what I have to do for the day the feeling slowly goes away or like this morning,I will wake,its in the 40s outside & feel hot all over & need to cool down.I take socks & blankets off & try to cool down.After a half hour or so,that feeling is gone I feel normal again.The sweats & hot feeling can wake me right up.I always have next to my bed,wheat crackers,a 16oz bottle of ice-tea,books & mag & my pill case.This to relax & take my mind off whats going on.Sometimes I go to work & feel better as the day goes on.If I have had one overnight,I know the next morning from a headache to I have bitten my tongue or the side of my mouth.I will relax & do nothing,maybe read,sleep & then the laptop.I have written alot,but its help this morning now to feel normal again.Its been about two months since the last attack & I would like to make it a four month gap.
author: Glenn Gilbert

author: Epilepsy Advocate

label: positive
message: Simple-Partial seizures really don't require any recovery time for me.  Unless you know me as well as my wife you won't even know that I am having a seizure.  And she only catches about half of them.  What helps me the most is to NOT focus on the S-P seizure and remember to breathe.  As soon as I start to focus on a S-P I am much more likely to push myself into a Complex-Partial.  There are no perfect answers.  Everyone has a different body so remember that.  Find what works best for you and never stop looking for a better way.
author: Chad Martin

label: negative
message: I have grand mal seizures. I am first confused then I remember shortly after. Then I sleep for a long time. I am weak like I just ran a marathon. I am seizure free now for 6 years. My longest since my first in 1999.
author: EddieandWendy Reyes

label: neutral
message: My "Assistance Dog" helps me recover. He licks my face.
author: Edward Crane

label: negative
message: I get so tired and want to sleep every bit of energy is taking from me.. i yawn and yawn its so hard to do anything so rest is important..
author: Roxanne Tisnado-Monnier

label: negative
message: Rest and being around supportive people
author: Jordan David

label: negative
message: My son has passed on from this life,he had 3 different kinds of seizures,this was 1 of them.i would gently put him on his side,so not 2 choke,i would rub his forehead n hold his hand n talk 2 him.that always seemed 2 comfort him n bring him out.
author: Michele Manning

label: neutral
message: My sons sleeps hours after he seizes.
author: Catherine Carraro

label: negative
message: Sleep and lots of water.  Is it normal for someone to drink like they haven't drank anything in weeks?
author: Tiffany Perdue Blackstock

label: negative
message: I don't know what they were until a few years ago when I had a grand mal. Had simples all my life, but early in life I would be stunned for a few seconds, but as I became older older I learned how to work through them.  I am a professional firefighter and a month before my grand mal I had a simple going in a on heavily involved residence fire.   I started as I made the door and I pushed in extinguishing the fire, but I had conditioned myself over the years to work through these episodes,, I know it sounds crazy!
author: Kevin Landrum

label: negative
message: just a moment or two... depending on how rough.  I'm blurry on the line between Simple and Complex partial;  I don't always zonk out or always shake, but sometimes I'm conscious during seizures that include shaking and last longer.  Often I can't communicate or at least not well, but I hear and see.  I have too much variety in my opinion.  Aura/simple that morph into complex, drop w/o aura, just auras, sometimes crazy or crazy long post-ictal and sometimes quick recovery...
author: Grace Johnson

label: neutral
message: I'm currently having an immense amount of trouble in college due to my SPs and I've been on 5 different medications in the past 6 months hoping to try and stop them. They are gonna put the VNS system in to hopefully control them. I sleep a lot and drink lots of water/juice. This is extremely difficult to deal with but I'm trying to get by. Praying for everyone who deals with these or any in general!
author: Lorna Harris

label: neutral
message: Quiet and a nap.....I usually present with migraine before and after.
author: Colleen Furno

label: positive
message: All I have to say is - thank god for the internet because without all these comments and response from site and blogs from many people who deal with epilepsy . I wouldn't have any idea what my son goes through . Thanks to all of you

label: neutral
message: Sleep and water I be feeling dehydrated and tired

label: negative
message: I just need to sit down for a few minutes and relax
author: Tom Curran

label: neutral
message: I just needed a minute to get refocused and I went back to doing what I was before the seizure

label: neutral
message: Sleep and some Gatorade. It really helps with the headache

label: neutral
message: I have Grand-mal and petite mal seizures around my menstrual period.   Sleep and resting my body helps tremendously!

label: negative
message: I don't know what happens to me. I get this when I am sleeping or going to sleep. Never seen a doctor yet.

label: negative
message: Basically just taking it easy with some stress free time and maybe a bit of sleep

label: negative
message: a minor simple partial I just do some slow, calming deep breathing to recover; however I have had simple partials from which I needed to sleep several hours to recover as well.  Never as severely as the tonic clonics of course, but still very taxing
author: Rhea Hansen

label: neutral
message: At first was rest. But then I had the surgery and have been seizure free..<ed><U+00A0><U+00BD><ed><U+00B8><U+0083>

label: neutral
message: rest is all i can say when i have sezuires i cant function for a while ive bitten my tounge and soiled my clothes  dont remeber much so i just rest

label: neutral
message: Was any of you academically challenged in school or college due to the location of your S-P sz

label: negative
message: I usually out for the rest of the day so I sleep about 8 hours and then I'm OK

label: neutral
message: My pit Angel helps me recover fr all kinds of seizures!!! She is self taught and is amazing.  SLEEP
author: Debi Pictum-Lotta

label: positive
message: My son seizures happen in the morning and last about 40 seconds...sleep helps too!
author: Virginia Garza Segura

label: neutral
message: My son has partial complex epilepsy and he blacks out for 30-45 seconds and it takes him about 30 minutes to rest before he regains body function. He just rests.
